item.title: Erin add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Pretend to be good always and even God will be fooled." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Erin add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "We are what we pretend to be, so we must be careful about what we pretend to be." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Erin add a quote by Carl Sandburg
item.description:
"Give me hunger, pain and want, Shut me out with shame and failure From your doors of gold and fame, Give me your shabbiest, weariest hunger!
But leave me a little love." -- Carl Sandburg

item.title: Erin add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description:
"you son of a bitch, she said, I am <i>trying</i> to build a meaningful relationship.
you can't build it with a hammer, he said." -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: Erin add a quote by Thomas Pynchon
item.description: "I came," she said, "hoping you could talk me out of a fantasy." Cherish it!" cried Hilarious, fiercely. "What else do any of you have? Hold it tightly by it's little tentacle, don't let the Freudians coax it away or the pharmacists poison it out of you. Whatever it is, hold it dear, for when you lose it you go over by that much to the others. You begin to cease to be." -- Thomas Pynchon

item.title: Erin add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description: "Some people never go crazy. What truly horrible lives they must lead." -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: Erin add a quote by Jon Agee
item.description: "Eva, can I pose as Aesop in a cave?" No, Don." -- Jon Agee

item.title: Erin add a quote by E. E. Cummings
item.description: "Unbeing dead isn't being alive." -- E. E. Cummings

item.title: Erin add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "If you try and take a cat apart to see how it works, the first thing you have on your hands is a non-working cat." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Erin add a quote by Michio Kaku
item.description: "It is often stated that of all the theories proposed in this century, the silliest is quantum theory. In fact, some say that the only thing that quantum theory has going for it is that it is unquestionably correct." -- Michio Kaku

item.title: Erin add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Scientists have calculated that the chances of something so patently absurd actually existing are millions to one. But magicians have calculated that million-to-one chances crop up nine times out of ten." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Erin add a quote by Markus Zusak
item.description: "I wanted to tell the book thief many things, about beauty and brutality. But what could I tell her about those things that she didn't already know? I wanted to explain that I am constantly overestimating and underestimating the human race-that rarely do I ever simply estimate it. I wanted to ask her how the same thing could be so ugly and so glorious, and its words and stories so damning and brilliant." -- Markus Zusak

item.title: Erin add a quote by Nicole Krauss
item.description:
"2. WHAT I AM NOT
My brother and I used to play a game. I'd point to a chair. "THIS IS NOT A CHAIR," I'd say. Bird would point to the table. "THIS IS NOT A TABLE." "THIS IS NOT A WALL," I'd say. "THAT IS NOT A CEILING." We'd go on like that. "IT IS NOT RAINING OUT." "MY SHOE IS NOT UNTIED!" Bird would yell. I'd point to my elbow. "THIS IS NOT A SCRAPE." Bird would lift his knee. "THIS IS ALSO NOT A SCRAPE!" "THAT IS NOT A KETTLE!" "NOT A CUP!" "NOT A SPOON!" "NOT DIRTY DISHES!" We denied whole rooms, years, weathers. Once, at the peak of our shouting, Bird took a deep breath. At the top of his lungs, he shrieked: "I! HAVE NOT! BEEN! UNHAPPY! MY WHOLE! LIFE!" "But you're only seven," I said." -- Nicole Krauss

item.title: Erin add a quote by John Green
item.description: "I was born into Bolívar's labyrinth, and so I must believe in the hope of Rabelais' Great Perhaps." -- John Green

item.title: Erin add a quote by Philip K. Dick
item.description: "Reality is that which, when you stop believing in it, doesn't go away." -- Philip K. Dick

item.title: Erin add a quote by François Rabelais
item.description: "Readers, friends, if you turn these pages Put your prejudice aside, For, really, there's nothing here that's outrageous, Nothing sick, or bad — or contagious. Not that I sit here glowing with pride For my book: all you'll find is laughter: That's all the glory my heart is after, Seeing how sorrow eats you, defeats you. I'd rather write about laughing than crying, For laughter makes men human, and courageous." -- François Rabelais

item.title: Erin add a quote by Jean Baudrillard
item.description: "the neighborhood is nothing but a protective zone- remodeling, disinfection, a snobbish and hygenic design- but above all in a figurative sense: it is a machine for making emptiness." -- Jean Baudrillard

item.title: Erin add a quote by G.K. Chesterton
item.description: "Poets have been mysteriously silent on the subject of cheese." -- G.K. Chesterton

item.title: Erin add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Erin add a quote by Angela Carter
item.description: "The tiger will never lie down with the lamb; he acknowledges no pact that is not reciprocal. The lamb must learn to run with the tigers." -- Angela Carter
